name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Williamsburg

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.text: Good hotel for the money. I visited for two nights on business.

reviews.title: Decent
reviews.text: Pros: friendly desk staff, clean room and hotel, good shower, comfortable bed, nice pillows, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, flat screen TV.

reviews.title: Great time with friends
reviews.text: Cons: smaller, rough bath towels and a common pet peeve of mine – no easily available electric outlet at the bedside. Had to pull out the mattress, search for the plug, and unplug the alarm clock in order to have a plug near the bed. Why don’t hotels realize folks want a plug near the bed? A plug strip or a lamp with a plug (like the one on the desk) would solve the problem. Simple.

reviews.title: Not the Ritz, but good for the family.
reviews.text: Decent hotel. It's in a central location and just minutes from Colonial Williamsburg. There was a lot of parking, nice breakfast area, many options for restaurants nearby and near a local grocery store. The rooms are pretty standard rooms. Nothing too special about them. The walls however were way too thin. I can hear pretty much everything going on outside and around. The hotel is pretty big. Very accommodating for the family. The suite rooms are nice as well.The beds were very comfortable, however, it was pretty much a thin sheet for a blanket.

reviews.title: Dissappointing
reviews.text: great price at a good location. staff was very helpful and courteous. there are a lot of eating places within walking distance. rooms were clean, and the beds comfortable. the breakfast downstairs was sufficient. we will definitely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly. Breakfast is far beyond the cold muffins, etc at other hotels. It comes with sausage eggs waffles - CUT fruit - yougerts etc. Do unload however under the breezeway before you park
reviews.title: Center Location - Perfect

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights while in Williamsburg for The Grand Illumination on Dec. 2.
reviews.title: Wonderful value accomodations in Williamsburg.

reviews.text: The rooms were not the biggest I've enjoyed, especially under the heading of 'Suite', but they were clean, comfortable, and a great value. There was a mini-fridge, microwave, 2 televisions, a sofa, and 4 chairs.
reviews.title: Excellent value in Williamsburg

reviews.text: The rooms are somewhat dated, but offer every amenity for a great stay in a hotel serving a city where your attention is all AWAY from the hotel.
reviews.title: good hotel for visiting the area

reviews.text: The rate also includes a "deluxe" continental breakfast. While there were no eggs Benedict (none were expected) they provide scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, and large selections of other breakfast items. There is an indoor pool, a spa and an exercise room. We could not help but be impressed with the value this Marriott brand offers. Lastly, the staff is attentive and very courteous.
reviews.title: Disappointment? Or higher expectations?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a bus trip. When researching I was disappointed it wasn't closer to Colonial Williamsburg (as in walking distance). However, it is conveniently located near several eateries, a Wall Greens and a Whitley's Peanuts. The room was roomy. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very helpful and polite. The breakfast included eggs and sausage as well as waffles and the usual fair.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairfield in early January 2013. Check-in was easy; the front desk personnel pleasant and helpful. Our room felt small; the furniture needed an update. The bathroom was also a bit smaller than we are used to for a Marriott property, and the tile around the bathtub was cracked in several places. We also noted mold in the caulking where the bathtub meets the tile.
reviews.title: Convenient location, slightly below average property

reviews.text: The pool area was nice, but the hot tub does not have jets. This was a bit unusual for us. The temperature of the hot tub was cozy, so it was nice to sit and relax.
reviews.title: Good location, average hotel

reviews.text: Our heating unit was very loud whenever it was operating. It woke us up several times during the night.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - good location.

reviews.text: The location is the main advantage of this property. It is placed close to the historic area and took us less than 5 minutes from the hotel parking lot to reach the parking area at Colonial Williamsburg. There are also a number of restaurants adjacent to the property, so it was easy to walk and find a decent lunch or dinner.
reviews.title: Worth value hotel for a family!

reviews.text: The Fairfield Inn and Suites is at the low end of the Marriott hierarchy, and it shows. While the suite we used was clean and well thought-out, the amenities were few, and the experience less than I would have liked. This is a place where the drinking cups are plastic and plastic-wrapped, where the plates and cutlery in the breakfast room are also plastic. When we visited the hotel was noisy both because of ineffective soundproofing (thanks for the marital sound effects, people across the hall), and because it was also occupied by teens there for a soccer tournament. Sadly, there's no obvious hotel security to keep the rampant kids in check.
reviews.title: Typical Fairfield Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there were also maintenance issues. The key card machine only worked occasionally, the card readers on exterior doors sometimes didn't work, and in one case an exit door wouldn't open (I'm sure the fire marshall would be delighted). Lamps in our room didn't work. the bed sagged and game me a backache.
reviews.title: Professionally comfortable

reviews.text: But at least it was clean.
reviews.title: Not exactly up to brand standards

reviews.text: There's a free breakfast that reminded me of my boot camp days - what appeared to be powdered eggs, where the curds were tough and floating in a pool of water. Sausage patties had the flavor of steamed pork with no spices. A coffee aftertaste you couldn't eradicate.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, free breakfast!

reviews.text: Fortunately there's an IHOP that shares the parking lot. go there for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great experience!

description: Just 1 mile from Colonial Williamsburg and 2 miles Premium Outlets, Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott is situated in the heart of the area's top attractions. This Williamsburg VA hotel provides visitors with easy access to the adjacent Merchants Square, plus the College of William & Mary. Complete your tour of Virginia's Historic Triangle with visits to nearby Jamestown and Yorktown. Our hotel near Busch Gardens, Water Country USA, Williamsburg Winery, and Williamsburg Pottery equals fun around every corner! Golfers will have more than a dozen renowned championship courses to choose from at our hotel near Williamsburg golf courses such as Golden Horseshoe, Kingsmill, Kiskiack, Ford's Colony and Williamsburg National. An ideal location plus amenities such as luxury bedding, complimentary Internet access, complimentary continental breakfast, indoor pool, fitness center, business center, Market and on-site laundry make Fairfield Inn & Suites the perfect choice for your visit to Williamsburg!
